item.title: Little Witch in the Woods for PC delayed to September 15
item.content:encoded:
• PC

The Hollow Knight: Silksong effect.

SUNNY SIDE UP has delayed the full release of witch life simulation game Little Witch in the Woods from its previously planned September 4 release to September 15, citing Hollow Knight: Silksong‘s September 4 release as reason for the delay. It is currently in Early Access for PC via Steam.

The delay follows a a series of other titles delayed due to Hollow Knight: Silksong, including CloverPit, Aeterna Lucis, Demonschool, and Baby Steps.

Here is the full message from SUNNY SIDE UP on the delay:

Hello, everyone. This is SUNNY SIDE UP.

We’d like to extend our sincere gratitude to all of you for your patience in awaiting the official release of Little Witch in the Woods. Development of the full version has taken longer than anticipated. We fully understand the anxiety and fatigue you are experiencing.

The past few years have seen us investing immense time and effort into making this game. It’s your faith in us, your support during Early Access, and your assistance in every aspect that have kept us going till the day.

Recently, we finally announced with excitement the release date of the full version. However, shortly after our announcement, we learned that Hollow Knight: Silksong—a highly anticipated new title of a masterpiece in the gaming industry—is launching on the same day. Silksong is a game we look up to with awe as developers, and eagerly anticipate as players. Given its immense influence, we fear that launching Little Witch in the Woods on the same day would not only dishearten our dedicated team, but also disappoint our devoted audience.

Having taken everything into account, we now decide to adjust the release of the full version to September 15, 2025.

We sincerely apologize for the delay. To honor your patience and support, we promise to keep working on the game and deliver Little Witch in the Woods in a highly polished form.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/little-witch-in-the-woods-for-pc-delayed-to-september-15

item.title: Baby Steps delayed to September 23
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

More Hollow Knight: Silksong delays.

Publisher Devolver Digital and developers Gabe Cuzzillo, Maxi Boch, and Bennett Foddy have delayed Baby Steps from its previously planned September 8 release date to September 23. It will be available for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam

A new trailer indicates Hollow Knight: Silksong‘s September 4 release was the reason for the delay.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Play as Nate, an unemployed failson with nothing going for him, until one day he discovers a power he never knew he had… putting one foot in front of the other.

Explore a world shrouded in mist, one step at a time. Hike the serene mountains by placing each footstep yourself, in original physics-based gameplay from the minds behind Ape Out and Getting Over It. Take in the sights, fall in love with the local fauna, and try to find meaning in a wasted life.

Get ready to fall for Nate, in Baby Steps, a literal walking simulator.

Key Features

  • Fully-simulated physics based walking.
  • A world that seems to come alive with a dynamic soundtrack built up out of 420 beats and vibes.
  • A lengthy trek up a mountain-sized mountain that you can explore at your own pace, or slower.
  • Fully dynamic onesie soilage system.
  • Non-collectible hats.

Watch the new trailer below.

New Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/baby-steps-delayed-to-september-23

item.title: Hello Kitty and Friends: Freeze Tag Party coming west on November 6
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Play tag with Sanrio characters.

Nighthawk Interactive will release tag action game Hello Kitty and Friends: Freeze Tag Party for Switch on November 6 in the west, the publisher announced. Pre-orders are available now at retailers such as VGP. Every physical edition comes with a sticker set while supplies last.

Imagineer originally released Hello Kitty and Friends: Freeze Tag Party on March 27 in Japan under the title Sanrio Characters Miracle Match: Magical Onigokko.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nighthawk Interactive:

About

Hello Kitty and Friends: Freeze Tag Party is an action game where popular Sanrio characters play an exciting game of tag in a magical world! Choose to be either the Challenger (runner) or the Hunter (chaser) and enjoy thrilling tag matches using each character’s magical skills.

Collect Jewels as you play to unlock new characters and dress them up in a variety of adorable outfits. Take on over 70 different missions for an even greater challenge!

Step into a dreamlike magical world and enjoy unforgettable moments with all your favorite characters.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • 35 Adorable Sanrio Characters – Fan favorites like Hello Kitty, My Melody, and Cinnamoroll are here—along with many more! Each character comes with unique stats and magical skills, offering a variety of playstyles. Enjoy watching your favorite characters come to life with charming 3D animations and adorable movements!
    • Challengers Include – Hello Kitty, Hello Mimmy, Dear Daniel, My Melody, My Sweet Piano, Littleforestfellow, Little Twin Stars (Kiki, Lala), Cinnamoroll, Mocha, Cappuccino, Chiffon, Espresso, Poron, Pompompurin, Pochacco, Tuxedosam, Kerokerokeroppi, Hangyodon, Ahirunopekkle, Wish me mell, SUGARBUNNIES (Shirousa, Kurousa), Bonbonribbon, and U*SA*HA*NA.
    • Hunters Include – Kuromi, Baku, LLOROMANNIC (Berry, Cherry), Bad Badtz-Maru, Tzunko, Pandaba, andGOROPIKADON (Goro, Pika, Don).
  • Play Solo or With Friends and Family – Using local or cooperative play.
  • Unique Magical Skills – Each character has their own Skills—some are great for hiding, others for escaping, helping teammates, or chasing. As your character levels up, their magical skill also evolves, adding depth and replay value to every match.
  • Dress-Up Fun in the Shop – Head to the Shop to dress up your characters in stylish outfits! Try putting trendy glasses on Hello Kitty or dress My Melody in a dazzling gown—mix and match your favorite looks for each character.
  • Mission Mode – In addition to standard tag battles, challenge yourself in Mission Mode, where you’ll need to meet specific conditions to clear each stage. There are 70 missions in total—35 as a Challenger and 35 as a Hunter—each awarding Gold, Silver, or Bronze trophies depending on your performance. Aim for Gold in every mission and show off your tag mastery.
  • Magical Tag Battle System – Each match is a thrilling game of tag featuring six Challengers (runners) and two Hunters (chasers). Players take control of one character on either team.
    • Challengers win if at least one member escapes until the timer runs out.
    • Hunters win if they catch all Challengers within the time limit.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Western Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/hello-kitty-and-friends-freeze-tag-party-coming-west-on-november-6

item.title: Anomaly horror game CAPTURED coming to PS5 on September 12, Xbox Series on October 7
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for PC.

Publisher Perp Games and developer Puck Games will release anomaly horror game CAPTURED for PlayStation 5 on September 12, followed by Xbox Series on October 7, the companies announced.

CAPTURED first launched for PC via Steam on October 15, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Perp Games:

About

Explore a procedural generated+C3:C27 endless hallway filled with unusual phenomena and ever-changing rooms

Caught in a never-ending loop, leaving the house only leads you right back into the same hallway. Plunged in complete darkness, room after room, your once-familiar home feels increasingly alien.

CAPTURED is an analog horror game where you capture anomalies on camera to escape what seems to be an endless hallway in your own home. Investigate mysterious phenomena, survive frightening entities, and reach the end of the hallway!

Break the loop by exercising your memory skills. Use your camera to zoom in on suspicious changes and select their anomaly type. Missing or incorrectly identifying any unusual phenomena within a loop will wipe your camera’s memory. Correctly capture 13 anomalies to escape.

Watch out for unwanted company. While silence may be a good tactic, staying too long within a loop could give away your location. Use your flashlight, camera, and the doors strategically to survive each entity’s unique mechanics.

Using a custom movement experience, step into a nostalgic late ’90s aesthetic with realistic graphics, minimal UI, and a chilling atmosphere.

Key Features

  • Experience isolation and the eerie feeling of being trapped in a looping house set in the late 90s.
  • Explore a procedurally generated hallway filled with a chilling atmosphere.
  • Use your camera to zoom in on anomalies and capture them.
  • Identify and classify captured anomalies, including Object, Electronic, Lighting, Water, Missing Room, and Deformed Room.
  • Survive encounters with three monsters, each with unique traits and mechanics.
  • Immerse yourself in an analog horror experience featuring realistic graphics, a VHS 90s aesthetic, a dynamic camera system, and immersive flashlight movement.
  • Lingering can sometimes have its benefits as the leaderboards, available on console and PC, will feature the very best of anomaly hunters. The more anomalies you find, the higher you will climb!

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/anomaly-horror-game-captured-coming-to-ps5-on-september-12-xbox-series-on-october-7
